message.content:
Step 1: Identify the key figures from the cash flow statement.
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = -10,442,735.47  
• Net Profit = 3,744,117.89

Step 2: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio using the formula:  
  Ratio = (Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities) / (Net Profit)

Step 3: Plug in the numbers:  
  Ratio = -10,442,735.47 / 3,744,117.89 ≈ -2.79

Thus, the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio is approximately -2.79.

Below is the solution in the required JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-2.79"
  }
}
